channel.title: Where in the world is Osama Bin Laden?
channel.description:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Where_in_the_World_Is_Osama_Bin_Laden%3F
Pretty good documentary about the USA and the "war on terrorism". It's shown in a very objective way, which makes it better than most documentaries relating to this topic.
Do take a look, it is worth your time.

item.title: Where in the world is Osama Bin Laden?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Radeon:

This then leads you to ask yourself, is finding OBL worth the lives of American soldiers?

Not the only reason we’re there. Just be glad we got Saddam.

Read full topic
item.source: Where in the world is Osama Bin Laden?

item.title: Where in the world is Osama Bin Laden?
item.dc:creator: @MujaheD Radeon
item.description:
@MujaheD wrote:

I saw this a while ago and I don’t remember much. But there was something which I really found interesting. Morgan Spurlock was expecting a baby from his wife and when he finally arrived at the Afghanistan-Pakistan border, which is widely believed to be where OBL is hiding, he turned around and went back home. His baby was due by then and he made a point that it was clearly not worth risking his life to find OBL. This then leads you to ask yourself, is finding OBL worth the lives of American soldiers?

Read full topic
item.source: Where in the world is Osama Bin Laden?

item.title: Where in the world is Osama Bin Laden?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Where in the World Is Osama bin Laden?

Where in the World Is Osama Bin Laden? is a 2008 documentary film, conceived by Adam Dell and co written, produced, directed by and starring Morgan Spurlock, an American independent filmmaker. The title of the film is a play on the title of the television game show and computer game series, Where in the World Is Carmen Sandiego?, and other “Where in the World is” themes.

Pretty good documentary about the USA and the “war on terrorism”. It’s shown in a very objective way, which makes it better than most documentaries relating to this topic.

Do take a look, it is worth your time.

Read full topic
item.source: Where in the world is Osama Bin Laden?
